data.scheme_name: Raw Material Supply Scheme (RMSS) -15% Price Subsidy On Raw Material -Existing
data.benefits: Scheme provides 15% Price Subsidy on Yarn (through DBT to linked bank account).
data.eligibility: All units engaged in Handloom sector are eligible under the scheme.
data.conditions:
1. In case of misuse of benefit by the beneficiaries for the first time, the Office of DC (HL) shall be competent to recover the benefit amount with 10% interest. 
  2. In case of second misuse, besides recovery he shall be deprived from receiving supply for one year. 
  3. On third misuse, besides recovery and debarment for life, he/she shall be liable for criminal action under IPC and other criminal laws.
data.beneficiaries: All units engaged in Handloom sector are eligible under the scheme.
data.prerequisites:
1. In case of misuse of benefit by the beneficiaries for the first time, the Office of DC (HL) shall be competent to recover the benefit amount with 10% interest. 
  2. In case of second misuse, besides recovery he shall be deprived from receiving supply for one year. 
  3. On third misuse, besides recovery and debarment for life, he/she shall be liable for criminal action under IPC and other criminal laws.
data.context:
• The Handloom Sector is one of the largest unorganized economic activities and it constitutes an integral part of the rural and semi-rural livelihood engaging over 35 lakh persons. 
  • The sector engages over 25 lakh female weavers and allied workers which makes it an important source of economic empowerment of women.
data.objective: To encourage handloom weavers' involvement in the sector and help them compete with the mill sector, as handloom productivity is lower than powerloom.
data.description:
Scheme provides Cotton hank yarn, Domestic Silk, Woollen, Linen yarn and their blends required for production of handloom items are covered under the 15% price subsidy. For the purposes of price subsidy, the maximum quantity of yarn to be supplied to a weaver will be as below:

  •  Cotton (upto 20s counts) - 60 Kgs./loom/month 
  • Cotton (above 20s to 40s counts) - 30 Kgs./loom/month 
  • Cotton (above 40s to 80s) - 20 Kgs./loom/month 
  • Cotton (above 80s counts) - 15 Kgs./loom/month Domestic
  • Silk Yarn - 6 Kgs./loom/month 
  • Woolen Yarn (below 10s NM) - 50Kgs./loom/month 
  • Woolen Yarn(10s to39.99sNM) - 12Kgs./loom/month 
  • Woolen Yarn(40s NM & above) - 6Kgs./loom/month 
  • Linen Yarn (5 Lea to 10 Lea) - 20 Kgs/loom/month 
  • Linen Yarn above 10 Lea - 7kgs/loom/month 
  • Blended Yarn of Natural fibers - 6 Kgs./loom/month
data.how_to_apply: Application to be submitted in offline mode by the Executing Agency (EA) at the concerned Regional office of the National Handloom Development Corporation.
data.funding_mechanism:
1. If yarn is available at the depot, the beneficiary makes full payment, and the IA transfers the 15% subsidy within 48 hours. 
  2. If yarn is not available, the beneficiary pays a 15% advance to the depot, which then places the order with IA. 
  3. The 15% subsidy is transferred to the beneficiary within 48 hours after receiving the goods.
data.additional_info: No Capital cost for infrastructure is to be provided under the scheme.
data.checklist_info_a: Annexure 1 to Annexure 8 form required which is given in giudelines
